questions.question: A scientific theory explains things that happen in nature.
Scientific theories and laws CANNOT be modified
Evidence supporting that Earth's layers move over time (Plate Tectonics) is an example of a
Scientific theories do not change once they have been written down.
This describes what nature does under certain conditions.
This explains how and why an event in nature works
Although this is supported by a large amount of data, it CAN be modified if new data disagrees.
This explains how a process works under a given set of conditions with a mathematical formula.
Why are models used in science?

choices.answer: A scientific law cannot be proven without a model.
They are needed to organize the different types of science.
Scientists cant learn data without a model to represent it.
They represent concepts that cannot be studied directly.

questions.question: Which of the following tools would be most essential for a biologist studying cells?
Years ago, Earth was said to be flat. Which best explains why the model of Earth is now round?

choices.answer: Models can change even if there's no evidence to support it.
As more evidence was discovered, the model of Earth changed.
Models can only be made small, so the model was poorly made.
Models are a representation of products to be made in future

questions.question: A deer wears a monitor that tracks his movements. Which best describes the use of technology?

choices.answer: Technology has not improved this method of data collection.
Improved technology has lessened the effects of science.
Technology has oversimplified a complex system of migration.
Improved technology has increased data collection/monitoring
